results.title: Ten step discipline program
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Help for parents”
Ten step discipline program: Steps 1 to 3 helps teachers use Reality Therapy on themselves. Steps 4 to 6 provide teachers with a simple but effective approach. Steps 7 to 10 consider what procedures can be followed if students refuse to change their behaviour.

results.title: Helicopter management: fire
results.brief_description: The helicopter is widely used in all phases of forest fire control in America. This training film is designed to assist personnel in planning, organising and directing helicopter operations safely and efficiently.

results.title: Heki-un-so and Kyoto
results.brief_description: A visit to the ancient city of Kyoto which is the cradle of ten centureis of history and tradition. Shows the beautiful Heki-un-so gardens, created in the traditional Japanese style, during the four seasons of the year, as well as many examples of ancient and modern Japanese buildings, a tea ceremony and many ceremonies and festivals which are part of the way of life in this ancient capital city of Japan.

results.title: Heidi Di Santo's guide to relaxation
results.brief_description: Heidi Di Santo teaches a relaxation technique to assist with combating stress in the workplace. Stress is something which affects the productivity of most workplaces, and this video offers suggestions on how to minimize the stress and increase productivity.

results.title: Heavy petting
results.brief_description: Using footage from Hollywood in the 50’s and 60’s and educational material from the era, known personalities reflect on what it was like to be a living, breathing, sexual being in the 1950’s or 60’s. People such as Allan Ginsberg, William Burroughs, Sandra Bernhard, Francis Fisher, Frederic Lahey, John Oates and Zoe Tamerlaine discuss issues such as; dating, masturbation, petting, falling in love, menstruation, things you did to look cool, cruising, parties, dances, teen pregnancy, STD, and all the other concerns surrounding being a teenager. Set to a soundtrack of music from the decades in question, this snappy and entertaining documentary presents the viewer with a slice of 50’s and 60’s nostalgia.

results.title: Heart attack
results.creator_credit: Imre Horvath and CBS News Production
results.brief_description: America’s number one killer is the heart attack and if you are going to have one, you’re better off having it in Seattle. This is the opening message of this film which shows that it is necessary to deal with a coronary in the first crucial moments.
